intro: Eriogonum rixfordii, commonly known as the Rixford's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss. Eriogonum rixfordii is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive flower structures and ecological importance to local wildlife.
